Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I first began listening to podcasts about a year and a half ago.  Chris, my=
 former co-host, suggested The 2600 Game by Game Podcast.  I've still not c=
aught up on all those episodes, but I'm getting close.  One of my favorite =
parts of any podcast, especially Ferg's podcast, are the Christmas/holiday =
memories that people share.  I've heard all sorts of great Atari holiday-re=
lated stories, but for some reason Ferg has been suppressing all the storie=
s when people "boo" the Atari and are gung ho for the Bally.  It tell ya-- =
it's a conspiracy.  (Okay, it might be all in my head!)

I'm sure that ther=
e must be some Bally Arcade/Astrocade stories out there.  If you're one of =
those few people who got a Bally Arcade under the Christmas tree on Christm=
as Day, then I'd love to hear your story.  Maybe the Bally was your only sy=
stem.  Or, perhaps you already had an Atari and you pitted the two systems =
against each other.  Maybe you got a Bally Arcade very early (in January 19=
78) before the Atari VCS was king of America's living rooms.  Or, maybe you=
 got it as a gift while it was on clearance in 1984 for $25.  Do you have a=
 sad tale to tell that involves asking for an Astrocade, but you got an Ata=
ri instead?  Were you were up all night crying about what might have been? =
 Possibly you have a four-player tale of playing 99 rounds of Checkmate aga=
inst your parents and little sister on Christmas morning.

If your tale is =
holiday related (Christmas, Hanukkah, or whatever you celebrate), then I'd =
love to hear it!  Please write in (email the show) and tell us all about it=
.  If you're one of those awesome folks who likes to record audio feedback,=
 then that's welcome too.

The next episode of the Astrocast will feature t=
his holiday feedback in the December (okay, more like mid-January) episode.=


I can't wait to hear your tales!

Adam

--_000_CY1PR16MB0395F0330B0700DE0D6854E7C86A0CY1PR16MB0395namp_

<p></p>
<div>I first b=
egan listening to podcasts about a year and a half ago.  Chris, my for=
mer co-host, suggested The 2600 Game by Game Podcast.  I've still not =
caught up on all those episodes, but I'm getting close.  One of my fav=
orite parts of any podcast, especially
 Ferg's podcast, are the Christmas/h=
oliday memories that people share.  I've heard all sorts of great Atar=
i holiday-related stories, but for some reason Ferg has been suppressing al=
l the stories when people "boo" the Atari and are gung ho for the=
 Bally.  It
 tell ya-- it's a conspiracy.  (Okay, it might be all=
 in my head!)<br>
<br>
I'm sure that there must be some Bally Arcade/Astroc=
ade stories out there.  If you're one of those few people who got a Ba=
lly Arcade under the Christmas tree on Christmas Day, then I'd love to hear=
 your story.  Maybe the Bally was your only system.  Or, perhaps
=
 you already had an Atari and you pitted the two systems against each other=
.  Maybe you got a Bally Arcade very early (in January 1978) before th=
e Atari VCS was king of America's living rooms.  Or, maybe you got it =
as a gift while it was on clearance in 1984
 for $25.  Do you have a s=
ad tale to tell that involves asking for an Astrocade, but you got an Atari=
 instead?  Were you were up all night crying about what might have bee=
n?  Possibly you have a four-player tale of playing 99 rounds of Check=
mate against your
 parents and little sister on Christmas morning.<br>
<br>=

If your tale is holiday related (Christmas, Hanukkah, or whatever you cele=
brate), then I'd love to hear it!  Please write in (email the show) an=
d tell us all about it.  If you're one of those awesome folks who like=
s to record audio feedback, then that's welcome
 too.<br>
<br>
The next epi=
sode of the Astrocast will feature this holiday feedback in the December (o=
kay, more like mid-January) episode.<br>
<br>
I can't wait to hear your tal=
es!<br>
<br>
Adam<br>
